paragraph: Paul Durham (born September 9, 1968) is an American musician and producer, a solo singer-songwriter and the lead singer of rock bands Black Lab, Stray Palace, and Cake or Death. He is the writer of two Billboard charting songs, "Wash it Away" and "Time Ago" from Black Lab's Geffen Records debut, Your Body Above Me, and is represented by EMI Music Publishing and Secret Road Music.
2004: Ten Million Years - Songs from the Nineteen Nineties
2006: Your Body Above Me - The Directors Cut
2012: Best of the MP3 of the Month Club
2015: Live Acoustic from the Mercury Lounge
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: "Keep Myself Awake"
Can't Hardly Wait: "Tell Me What to Say"
"Your Ghost" on Hot Hands: A Tribute to Throwing Muses & Kristin Hersh (Kuma-chan Records, 2003)
